description: Conditions should abstain and refrain about breastfeeding.
title: Conditions should abstain and refrain about breastfeeding.
content:
- The state should not always include.
   - Children with disorders of the formation and function of hepatocytes with enzyme used to digest milk as galactosemia, maple syrup urine disease (MSUD), phenylketonuria. It is necessary to eat milk formula.
   - Patients infected with HIV.


 - Conditions that should include a temporary suspension.

   - Children born premature (<32 weeks), or very low weight (<1500 g) or a low blood sugar. This baby needs to be breast milk with formula.
   - Sick mother can not breastfeed, as there is infection in the bloodstream.
   - Mother sick with infections that may be transmitted to the child, such as tuberculosis, herpes, chickenpox.
   - Mothers receive drugs that affect children, such as anticonvulsants psychiatric drug treatment iodine-131.
